data.chText: 原因；起因
data.enText: the person or thing that makes sth happen

data.chText: 失业是贫困的主要原因。
data.enText: Unemployment is a major cause of poverty.

data.chText: 对那场火灾及其可能的起因进行了讨论。
data.enText: There was discussion about the fire and its likely cause.

data.chText: 酒后驾车是导致交通事故最常见的原因之一。
data.enText: Drinking and driving is one of the most common causes of traffic accidents.

data.chText: 理由；动机；缘故
data.enText: a reason for having particular feelings or behaving in a particular way

data.chText: 没有理由担忧。
data.enText: There is no cause for concern .

data.chText: 饭菜好极了，我没理由抱怨。
data.enText: The food was excellent─I had no cause for complaint .

data.chText: 理由充分；无缘无故
data.enText: with/without good cause (= with/without a good reason)

data.chText: （支持或为之奋斗的）事业，目标，思想
data.enText: an organization or idea that people support or fight for

data.chText: 动物保护主义者去年为保护动物募集了7万英镑。
data.enText: Animal welfare campaigners raised £70 000 for their cause last year.

data.chText: 崇高的事业
data.enText: a good cause (= an organization that does good work, such as a charity)

data.chText: 为共和党的事业而奋斗
data.enText: fighting for the Republican cause

data.chText: 诉讼案
data.enText: a case that goes to court
be for/in a good cause

data.chText: 做好事；行善
data.enText: worth doing, because it is helping other people

data.chText: 使发生；造成；引起；导致
data.enText: to make sth happen, especially sth bad or unpleasant

data.chText: 他们知道引起这场火灾的原因吗？
data.enText: Do they know what caused the fire?

data.chText: 你又在惹麻烦吗？
data.enText: Are you causing trouble again?

data.chText: 恶劣的天气给许多农民造成了困难。
data.enText: The bad weather is causing problems for many farmers.

data.chText: 危险驾驶造成的死亡
data.enText: deaths caused by dangerous driving

data.chText: 收成不好导致物价急剧上涨。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The poor harvest caused prices to rise sharply.

data.chText: 这项工程现在仍然给他带来许多的麻烦。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: The project is still causing him a lot of problems.

data.text: reason ♦ grounds ♦ excuse ♦ motive ♦ need ♦ justification ♦ cause ♦ pretext

data.chText: 以上各词均指事情发生或做某事的原因、理由、解释。
data.enText: These are all words for a cause or an explanation for sth that has happened or that sb has done.
reason

data.chText: 指某事发生或做某事的原因、理由、解释、正当理由、道理：
data.enText: a cause or an explanation for sth that has happened or that sb has done; a fact that makes it right or fair to do sth

data.chText: 他说不行，但没有说明原因。
data.enText: He said no but he didn't give a reason.
grounds

data.chText: 指说、做或相信某事的充分理由、根据：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a good or true reason for saying, doing or believing sth

data.chText: 你没有理由抱怨。
data.enText: You have no grounds for complaint.
excuse

data.chText: 指为自己行为所作的辩护、借口、理由：
data.enText: a reason, either true or invented, that you give to explain or defend your behaviour; a good reason that you give for doing sth that you want to do for other reasons

data.chText: 又迟到了！你这次有什么借口？
data.enText: Late again! What's your excuse this time?

data.chText: 这使我有理由开车去了。
data.enText: It gave me an excuse to take the car.
motive

data.chText: 指动机、原因：
data.enText: a reason that explains sb's behaviour

data.chText: 这起谋杀案看不出有什么动机。
data.enText: There seemed to be no motive for the murder.
need

data.chText: （常用于否定句）指必须、需要：
data.enText: (usually used in negative statements) a good reason to do sth

data.chText: 你明天不必早起。
data.enText: There is no need for you to get up early tomorrow.
justification

data.chText: 指事物存在或做某事的正当理由：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a good reason why sth exists or is done

data.chText: 我看不出还能提出什么理由再加税了。
data.enText: I can see no possible justification for any further tax increases.

data.chText: 用grounds还是justification？
justification用于找出或明白做事的理由，或解释要做的事，常与little、no、some、every、without和not any等词连用。grounds多用于已存在的原因或已决定的（法律等）根据：道德／经济原因
data.enText: Justification is used to talk about finding or understanding reasons for actions, or trying to explain why it is a good idea to do sth. It is often used with words like little , no , some , every , without , and not any . Grounds is used more for talking about reasons that already exist, or that have already been decided, for example by law. moral/economic grounds
grounds or justification?
cause

data.chText: 指某种感情或行为产生的原因、动机、缘故：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a reason for having particular feelings or behaving in a particular way

data.chText: 不必恐慌。
data.enText: There is no cause for alarm .
pretext

data.chText: 指为掩盖做某事（通常为不好的事）的真正理由而找的借口、托词：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a false reason that you give for doing sth, usually sth bad, in order to hide the real reason

data.chText: 他借口有事要处理，早早离开了聚会。
data.enText: He left the party early on the pretext of having to work.
(a/an) reason/grounds/excuse/motive/need/justification/cause/pretext for sth
the reason/motive behind sth
on the grounds/pretext of/that…
(a) good/valid reason/grounds/excuse/motive/justification/cause
the main/primary reason/grounds/excuse/motive/justification/cause

means: (支持或为之奋斗的)事业，目标，思想

ex.chText: 是什么原因使汤姆辞职的?
ex.enText: What caused Tom to quit his job?

ex.chText: 他们的痛苦引起了我们的同情。
这也许会引起他对这些学科的兴趣。
ex.enText: It may arouse his interest in these subjects.

synonyms.bx: 指引起某种情感、态度等。

ex.chText: 成功给这位老人带来了极大的满足感。
ex.enText: The success brought the old man great satisfaction.

synonyms.bx: 指导致某种情况或某种情感产生。

ex.chText: 新经理使公司发生了巨大的变化。
ex.enText: The new manager effected great changes in the firm.

synonyms.bx: 指引发某事，强调产生的效果。

ex.enText: She gave her reason for being late.

ex.chText: 他拒绝解释为何作出这个决定。
ex.enText: He refused to explain the reasons behind his decision.

ex.chText: 我们不知道她为什么没回家。
ex.enText: We don't know the reason why she didn't come home.
He has reason to feel happy.

synonyms.bx: 指某事发生的原因或做某事的正当理由，常后接介词 for 及 why 或 that 引导的从句，作“理由”解时还可后接动词不定式。

ex.chText: 缺乏体育锻炼是青少年学生肥胖的主要原因。
ex.enText: Lack of physical exercise is the leading cause of obesity in young students.

ex.chText: 这次失败的根本原因是什么？
ex.enText: What was the fundamental cause of this failure?
There is no cause/reason for anxiety.

synonyms.bx: 指导致某事发生的行为、事件等；也指产生某种感情或做出某种举动的正当理由，作此义解时常可与 reason 换用。

ex.chText: 她总是能为自己的迟到找理由。
ex.enText: She always has an excuse for being late.

ex.chText: 你没来有什么正当理由？
ex.enText: What is your good excuse for not coming?

synonyms.bx: 指辩解的理由或推脱的借口，常后接介词 for。

ex.chText: 她给出了充分的离婚理由。
ex.enText: She gave good grounds for divorce.

ex.chText: 警方有充分理由起诉那家公司吗？
ex.enText: Did the police have reasonable grounds to file a lawsuit against that company?

synonyms.bx: 指做某事的正当理由，作此义解时通常用复数。

data.enText: be for/in a good cause

data.chText: 做好事；行善
data.enText: worth doing, because it is helping other people
make common cause with sb

data.chText: 与某人联合起来，与某人合作（以达到共同的目的）
data.enText: to be united with sb about sth that you both agree on, believe in or wish to achieve

tr: any entity that produces an effect or is responsible for events or results
a series of actions advancing a principle or tending toward a particular end
example: they worked in the cause of world peace
the team was ready for a drive toward the pennant

tr: a comprehensive term for any proceeding in a court of law whereby an individual seeks a legal remedy
example: the family brought suit against the landlord

tr: a justification for something existing or happening
example: he had no cause to complain
they had good reason to rejoice

tr: events that provide the generative force that is the origin of something
example: they are trying to determine the cause of the crash

tr: cause to act in a specified manner
example: The ads induced me to buy a VCR
My children finally got me to buy a computer
My wife made me buy a new sofa

tr: cause to happen or occur, not always intentionally

value.def: The cause of an event, usually a bad event, is the thing that makes it happen.

example.ex: Smoking is the biggest preventable cause of death and disease...
example.tran: 在可以预防的引发死亡和疾病的因素当中，吸烟排在第一位。

example.ex: The causes are a complex blend of local and national tensions.
example.tran: 原因很复杂，既有地方性冲突也有全国范围的紧张局势。

value.def: To cause something, usually something bad, means to make it happen.

example.ex: Attempts to limit family size among some minorities are likely to cause problems...
example.tran: 试图在某些少数民族地区限制生育可能会引起问题。

example.ex: This was a genuine mistake, but it did cause me some worry.
example.tran: 这是好心办错事，可是确实让我担心了一阵子。

example.ex: ...a protein that gets into animal cells and attacks other proteins, causing disease to spread.
example.tran: 进入动物细胞内攻击其他蛋白质、从而导致疾病传播的蛋白质

example.ex: ...the damage to Romanian democracy caused by events of the past few days.
example.tran: 过去几天发生的事件对罗马尼亚民主政体的危害

value.def: If you have cause for a particular feeling or action, you have good reasons for feeling it or doing it.

example.ex: Only a few people can find any cause for celebration...
example.tran: 只有少数几个人能找到庆祝的理由。

example.ex: Both had much cause to be grateful for the secretiveness of government in Britain.
example.tran: 双方都有充分的理由对英国政府的行事隐秘深表感激。

value.def: A cause is an aim or principle which a group of people supports or is fighting for.

example.ex: Refusing to have one leader has not helped the cause.
example.tran: 拒绝推举一名领导者对此项事业毫无帮助。

value.def: You use cause and effect to talk about the way in which one thing is caused by another.

example.ex: ...fundamental laws of biological cause and effect.
example.tran: 生物学上因果关系的根本法则

value.def: If one group of people makes common cause with another, they act together in order to achieve a particular aim even though their aims and beliefs are normally very different.

example.ex: They make common cause for a few purposes, but for the most part, they pursue their own interests.
example.tran: 他们因为几个目的而联手，可是多数情况下，他们追逐着各自的利益。

value.tran: (为了特定目的)与…联手，与…配合

value.def: If you say that something is in a good cause or for a good cause, you mean that it is worth doing or giving to because it will help other people, for example by raising money for charity.

example.ex: The Raleigh International Bike Ride is open to anyone who wants to raise money for a good cause.
example.tran: 想要为公益事业筹集资金的人都可以参加雷利国际自行车比赛。

value.tran: 为了公益事业;为了行善

trans: 共同事业；共同的事业；常见原因；普通原因；共同原因
原因分析；因果分析法；因果分析；分析原因；原因
